newsitem.title: NORWAY: High interest rates help burden Norway shares.
newsitem.headline: High interest rates help burden Norway shares.

text.p: Norwegian share prices fell on Tuesday on the back of higher interest rates and negative sentiment after a U.S. missile attack on Iraqi air defence targets.
The Total share index closed 0.9 percent down at 819 points in turnover worth a moderate 640 million crowns.
Oil-sensitive shares such as Saga Petroleum and Norsk Hydro ended 1.1 percent and 0.2 percent higher at 100 crowns and 296.50 crowns respectively as a result of high oil prices.
"I had expected these shares, maybe especially Saga, to rise more than they did," one broker said, suggesting the higher interest rates held back the share.
